title.english: Diary of Our Days at the Breakwater

description:
Introverted Hina Tsurugi is trying to adjust to her new school since moving from the countryside. And in spite of her unease around sea life, classmate Yuuki Kuroiwa somehow convinces her to join the Breakwater Fishing Club. She wants to be open to these new friends and experiences, but some of them are as strange as the fish they’re supposed to hook. Is she biting off more than she can chew?

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東潤一)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.

[Staff Page (Nichion)](https://www.nichionsakka.com/miki-sakurai)

Miki Sakurai was born in 1991 in Miyagi Prefecture. Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts. She studied composition with Tatsuhiko Nishioka, Yoshihiko Katori, and electronic acoustic music with Takenobu Mori. While studying at university, she began to play Irish music and produce music for art animation. Currently active in various fields, including theater.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akekodao) | [Agency Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/AkesakaSatomi.html) | [Blog](http://blog.animate.tv/akesaka/)

Satomi got her start in show business in 2001 when she won the "Idol Grand Prix", an idol contest sponsored by the manga magazine Nakayoshi. She became an event character for the anime "Tokyo Mew Mew" by joining the group Mew Five. She made her debut as a voice actress in 2004 in with role of Anzai Futaba from Koi Kaze, and as a stage actress a year later. She released her first single "Akeban!" in 2011. As a part of the BanG Dream! project, she also played the keyboard for the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia) as the character Rinko Shirokane up until September 2018, when she was forced to quit after suffering sudden deafness twice. Before Roselia, she had been playing the piano since a young age, and previously played classical music.

Satomi's hobbies include using computers, drawing, reading, gaming and sleeping. Her favorite food is umeboshi, and she loves animals, especially cats.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wiki, edited)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Agency Profile](http://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=35) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/U_sshr)

Non-Anime Roles:
- Lynette (Genshin Impact)
- Verina (Wuthering Waves)
- Ulu (Reverse: 1999)

__Height:__ 152 cm

[Profile (LINK PLAN)](http://link-plan.net/talent_takao.html) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/kanon-takao/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kanon_Takao) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanon_Takao) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高尾奏音)

Kanon Takao is a Japanese voice actress and the keyboardist of the band [Ave Mujica](https://anilist.co/staff/353935/Ave-Mujica). After passing an audition in 2014, she made her debut as part of the idol group Earth Star Dream. Following Earth Star Dream going on hiatus, she would continue her entertainment activities as a solo artist. When she was younger, she was a rising pianist who frequented competitions.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Noelle - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Soldier OW - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
